result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
8:56 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Benjamin John Bernal in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews the case on the record and advises the defendant of his right to counsel.  Court inquires if the defendant plans to retain counsel.  Defendant advises that he cannot afford an attorney.  Court will provide the defendant with the petition for court appointed attorney and have him complete the document today.  Defendant has questions about an IID exemption.  Court advises it will not address the issue today, the defendant will need to report back to the DMV to obtain some additional information and can then be addressed at a later court date if needed.  Court takes a break at 8:58 a.m. to allow the defendant time to complete the petition for court appointed attorney.

Case recalled at 9:08 a.m.; all appearances remain the same.  Court reviews the defendant's petition for court appointed attorney.  Court will approve the petition for appointment of counsel and orders repayment at the rate of $200.00 per month commencing 10/15/2022.  Court will adjourn for status of counsel in about 30 days.
Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
addressed to: Bejjamin John Bernal for hearing on 10/10/2020

ADDRESS INFO for Benjamin John Bernal
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 09-13-2022)
Prior: N81w13230 Fond Du Lac Ave Apt 18, Menomonee Falls, WI 53051

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle at all. Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision. The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring and drug testing through WCS. CAM duration and drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and drug testing. Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

2:20 PM Defendant Benjamin John Bernal in court, in custody. Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Benjamin John Bernal. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Attorney Herbers appears as friend of the court. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
